intro: Lindernia leucochroa, commonly known as white-veined lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features slender, upright stems and opposite, ovate leaves with prominent white veins. Its small, tubular flowers are typically pale pink to white, and they bloom in summer. Lindernia leucochroa is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas.
